greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), 0 <= k <= n, read by rows, given by [0, 2, 1, 3, 2, 4, 3, 5, 4, 6, 5, 7, 6, ...] DELTA [1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of lists of k unlabeled permutations whose total length is n. Unlabeled means each permutation is on an initial segment of the positive integers. Example: with dashes separating permutations, T(3,2) = 4 counts 1-12, 1-21, 12-1, 21-1. - _David Callan_, Nov 29 2007
For n > 0, -Sum_{i=0..n} (-1)^i*T(n,i) is the number of indecomposable permutations A003319. - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 13 2009
reference: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 171, #34.
formula: G.f. for the k-th column: (Sum_{i>=1} i!*t^i)^k = Sum_{n>=k} T(n, k)*t^n.
Sum_{k=0..n} T(n, k)*binomial(m, k) = A084938(m+n, m). - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 31 2004
T(n, k) = Sum_{j>=0} A090753(j)*T(n-1, k+j-1). - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 18 2004
If true then a continued fraction representation of the o.g.f. is 1 - t + t/(1 - x/(1 - t*x - x/(1 - 2*x/(1 - 2*x/(1 - 3*x/(1 - 3*x/(1 - 4*x/(1 - 4*x/(1 - ... ))))))))). (End)
maple: T := proc(n,k) option remember; if n=0 and k=0 then return 1 fi;
if n>0 and k=0 or k>0 and n=0 then return 0 fi;
for n from 0 to 10 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # _Peter Luschny_, Mar 03 2016
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 20 2018 *)
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 23 2004, Jun 14 2007
